titleStmt.title: List of tax payers from Philadelphia
titleStmt.author: Unknown

msContents.summary: A list of Philadelphia taxpayers residing outside the village; they are identified by patronymic, and, on few occasions, by the addition of another descriptive word. Opposite each name is the figure 45 drachmas 2 obols, an amount which represents the combined payment of the laographiaand pig tax.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is described

condition.ab: The top and bottom margins of P.Mich 879 are intact; the right margin has been lost, but the partially preserved column vi was the last, both because it stops halfway down the page and because the nmaes in col. vi correspond to thoe nams in P.Pric. I 14, col. v, which are found just before the final total at v. 22 (see below, p. 234). The traces of the least one more column can be seen at the left margin.

layout.ab: col. I: traces of (dr. 45 2 ob.) at various points along the left margin; col. II: 1-26; col. III: 27-51; Col. IV: 52-75; Col. V: 76-100; Col. VI: 101-115

handDesc.p: The papyrus was written by the same scribe who wote P.Pric. I 4, P.Corn 24 and P.Ryl. IV 595. ;Epsilons and alphas are similar espacially before tau and mu. The individual letters in this particular hand are larger and usually easier to read than those in the hand which produced the day-books, P.Pric. I 1-6. At the same time , they are somewhat smaller and less flamboyant than the hand which produced P.Princ. I 7 and P.Mich. inv. 885 verso (ined.) Noticeable the way the scribe writes the names "Petesouchos" and "Petosiris".

origin.origPlace: Philadelphia, Polemonos meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Herakles, son of Mysthos, granson oPaabos
Nekpheros, alias Pan, son of Pan
Mysthas, son of Mysthas, grandson of Isarous
Horos, alias Pano( ), son of Panetbys

provenance.p: Philadelphia, Polemonos meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
